wikipedia_page.main: Margaret Vines (16 January 1907 in Portuguese East Africa – 1 March 1997) was a British actress. She performed initially on stage, in the London West End, in the 1920s and 1930s. She then progressed into a career on screen, appearing in several films as well as TV productions.

response: * 1956 Margaret Vines as Gibbs in Morning at Seven

response: |Open All Night||George Pearson ||Frank Vosper, Margaret Vines ||  Drama||

Open All Night is a 1934 British drama film directed by George Pearson and starring Frank Vosper, Margaret Vines, Gillian Lind, Geraldine Fitzgerald and Michael Shepley. The screenplay concerns Anton, a Grand Duke who was forced to flee Russia after the 1917 revolution, and now works as the night manager at Paragon House, a London hotel, where he puts his life on the line to help somebody else.
* Margaret Vines as The Girl (Mary Willis)
*Margaret Vines, from September 1928 – June 1929, played juvenile leads in Caste, On Approval, If Four Walls Told, Dear Brutus, Magic, etc.

The Vicar of Bray is a 1937 British historical film with songs, directed by Henry Edwards, and starring Stanley Holloway, Hugh Miller, Felix Aylmer and Margaret Vines. These songs include the melody and first verse of the traditional English song which gives the film its title, along with a new verse on Cromwell's rule.
* Margaret Vines as Lady Norah Brendon, the Earl's daughter
